intro: Ardisia alajuelae, commonly known as the Costa Rican beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the cloud forests of Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Following flowering, it produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Ardisia alajuelae is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit display.
